title: Problem Solved? Information Extraction Design Space for Layout-Rich Documents using LLMs
author: Gaye Colakoglu (Zurich University of Applied Sciences), Gürkan Solmaz (NEC Laboratories Europe), Jonathan Fürst (Zurich University of Applied Sciences), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses information extraction from layout-rich documents, which could inform techniques for extracting structured data from multimodal audio data, enhancing applications in audio-language modeling.
background: The task involves extracting structured information from documents that combine visual elements and textual content, a complex problem that requires advanced processing techniques.
contribution: This paper introduces a design space for information extraction (IE) from layout-rich documents using large language models (LLMs), examining the effects of various design parameters on extraction performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior models like LayoutLMv3 require extensive fine-tuning and have limitations in adapting to new document types without tailored datasets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work demonstrates that well-configured general-purpose LLMs can achieve comparable performance to specialized models without the need for extensive training.

key_innovation: The paper proposes to refine the pipeline of information extraction by examining chunking, prompting, and output refinement strategies systematically.
real_world_impact: By demonstrating that general-purpose LLMs can effectively perform information extraction without the cost and effort of fine-tuning, this research paves the way for more accessible document processing solutions.
limitations: The evaluation is limited to a specific dataset (VRDU), which may restrict generalizability across diverse document types.

new_terms.information extraction: **Information extraction** refers to the process of converting unstructured data into structured information by identifying entities and relationships.
new_terms.large language models: **Large language models (LLMs)** are sophisticated models trained on vast datasets to perform various language tasks such as text generation and comprehension.

open_sourcing: The test suite is freely available at https://github.com/gayecolakoglu/LayIE-LLM.
